pkgmetadata.longdescription: The Matrix Algebra on GPU and Multicore Architecture project aims to develop a dense linear algebra library similar to LAPACK but for heterogeneous/hybrid architectures, starting with current "Multicore+GPU" systems.

use.flag: Use CUDA as the BLAS vendor for GPU.

Use ILP64 for MKL. Otherwise fallback to LP64 data model. [Do not use unless a dependency requires ILP64. ILP64 allows for 64-bit maximum array indexing for larger data sets and Fortran int8 (64-bit integer) use.]
Use MKL as the BLAS vendor for CPU.
Use OpenBLAS as the BLAS vendor for CPU.
Use ROCm as the BLAS vendor for GPU.
Use TBB for MKL threading. [TBB avoids oversubscription across processes.]
